THE LATEST TUMBLR BOT PASSWORD SCAM - PLEASE SHARE - 3rd Feb 2019

I got this message from an account I didn’t follow - their blog looks very authentic because the owner was fooled into giving over their password and then locked out of the blog

If you click on the link (on mobile) it takes you here

No official tumblr post NEEDS to be viewed in a web browser, EVER!

It takes you to the page below, where it asks for your account details.

Whoever started this will then steal your info and lock you out of your blog!

It should go without saying - do not enter any account info into this or anything like it.

ALWAYS navigate to Tumblr’s official homepage yourself.

Warning: mature content (lol no smut) cursing (if you're a homophobic get out of my life,...
body:
25th Gay Bar | H.S

2 5 T H  G A Y  B A R ( P A R T  1 )

Warning: mature content (lol no smut) cursing (if you’re a homophobic get out of my life, you ain’t welcome here)

Summary: kiko (you all know her) invited famous!reader to go to a gay bar to celebrate your reunion because you haven’t seen each other in like 2 years. little did you know her friends, and harry are also going to be there. not to mention you didn’t know it was the day after his 25th birthday. (i just made up some of the others names because honestly, im too lazy to google them)

Word Count: 2595

-

“so have you changed your mind yet?” kiko, your friend, asked with a small grin plastered on her face. the two of you had met a few years ago on an award show and you two hit it off almost instantly. softly shrugging your shoulders, you rolled your eyes as you gazed down at the busy roads of japan.

“i don’t think i’m ready for such extreme actives.” you answered numbly, running a hand through your long gorgeous locks that many women seemed to envy, though you didn’t know why, you hair was as bad as t-series. (Subscribe to Pewdiepie) “besides, what the hell am i gonna do in a bar, let alone one for gays?” you rambled, “i mean there is a little bit of gay inside me, but that’s it.” your tone was finalized as you looked down at the beautiful asian woman sitting in front of you with a large pout on her face.

“we’ll do it for fun then!” she urged you as she locked her tiny hands around your endlessly long legs. frowning, you grumbled a curse under your breath and immediately stood up to make your way to the kitchen. you had been staying in an expensive modern condo in japan for more than 3 weeks despite kiko’s protests that you should stay in her home instead.

“no, kiko. but thanks for asking anyways.” you leaned your body down on the countertop as you spoke each word. practically writhing in disappointment, kiko flopped down on the humongous couch near the front door with a loud cry of mock frustration. biting down on your lip to stop yourself from laughing, you drank a large portion of your freshly made tea and decided to join the model.

“one of these days, y/n y/l/n. i might just kill myself because of you.” she stated in a deadpanned tone, and a string of colorful words soon followed. “we haven’t seen each other for 2 years!” she reminded you, “where’s the wild y/n i used to hang out with?” kiko narrowed her eyes at you.

smiling evilly, you flashed her a cheeky grin and said, “she died, along with the old taylor swift.” laughing mockingly as she groaned, you rolled over your belly and opened up social media.

“it’s not even funny!” she cried out, face palming dramatically just for good measure.

ignoring her, you continued to scroll down on your instagram feed and felt your eyes widen in surprise. “kiko mizuhara dating harry styles? what the hell, never heard of this one before.” the last part of your sentence was but a mumble. feeling kiko’s curious eyes at you, you turned to face her and lifted up your phone, “apparently you’re dating harry styles now, cool.” you snickered.

she sighed, a sigh that would usually mean exhaustion or annoyance. “i already tweeted about it a few weeks ago, but the rumors still haven’t died down. i haven’t even met the guy personally yet, and everybody’s making such a fuss about it.”

“interesting,” you commented, “says here you follow each other in ig?” you rose a brow at that.

“yeah, but that’s it!” she defended herself, arms crossing across her chest almost instantly. once she didn’t hear an immediate response from you, a loud scoff came out of her lips. “you seriously think that i would lie to you about my love life?”

“course,” you replied with no hesitation making kiko feel offended. “m'kidding of course, i know you’d never hide something like that.” you flashed her an eerie grin. as your thumb continued to scroll lower, a few comments caught your attention and you felt your insides start to burn in fury. “their hating on you? seriously? what the fuck is wrong with them?” you fumed.

“it’s fine y/n, really, it is. those words mean nothing to me because i know that they’re not real.” she gave you two thumbs ups, and a big smile, one that you didn’t think was genuine.

“who started this rumor anyways?” you leaned your head down on the comfy couch and lazily asked kiko. “some guy named dan, supposedly.” she replied, “or at least that’s what my manager told me.”

groaning, you stretched your limbs out and said “people nowadays are so fucked up…all for some easy money, christ.”

“that’s why i come to you for advice, we just really get each other.” she piped up, earning a small almost shy smile from you. “by the way, i heard that their’s going to be a new album soon-”

-

you were woken up by the sound of your alarm clock blasting at full volume, grumbling a quiet ‘fuck’ you stood up from the comfortable bed and made your way to the bathroom after grabbing your outfit of the day from your big suitcase. choosing to wear an simple, yet very expensive (I ain’t bluffing -author) iconic gucci shirt, you paired it with high waisted ripped jeans, and a new pair of nike shoes.

yesterday had been a blast for you. reuniting with one of your good friends felt great and it even inspired you to write a song about friendship. though you weren’t sure if it was going to be a part of the album.

reaching for the only pair of shades that you brought in japan, you scarfed down your carry on bag for a hat. grinning like a cheshire cat after managing to grasp one, you placed it on top of your hair that was yet to be done into a proper hairstyle, you quickly made your way to the buffet room, making sure to hide you face as to not disrupt your so far peaceful morning.

grabbing a plate, you made your way to the fruit section and placed a bunch of strawberries, mangoes, grapes on top of your plate along with a glass of milk. you walked to the furthest empty table in the room and was quick to take a bite out of the juicy fruits. but not before taking a picture of it and posting the said picture on instagram of course.

you decided to caption it with a short ’sweet like me’ phrase and left it at that. taking another juicy bite out of the strawberry, you leaned your back down on the chair and eyed the view in front of you. random people were passing by the five star hotel, not even bothering to give it a glance. though the foreigners were a bit different, their eyes held a different story from the locals who couldn’t care less about some extravagant hotel that they most likely see everyday.

sighing to yourself, you reached for the cup of warm milk and took a small sip before placing it carefully back on the fancy looking table. gazing down at the people who were walking freely outside, you felt a wafting burning sensation start to form in your chest. envy was what you felt as you stared at them. you envied them for their freedom, the power to walk around anywhere without being followed by paparazzi or diehard fans. (Not that you didn’t appreciate your fans because you totally do)

“may i sit here?” a voice from your back broke you out of your small trance. sheila, a nice woman in her mid-thirties, greeted you with a beaming smile. while on your stay here, you had managed to make a few new friends, like sheila over here. you nodded your head with a grin making its way to your lips.

“such a lovely day, innit?” she commented, smiling lips covered with nude lipstick.

“couldn’t agree more,” you muttered softly.

“why so sad, dear.” her words were more of a statement than a question.  shaking your head, you gulped down what’s left with your glass of milk and said,

“nothing, just enjoying the view, is all.”

“tsk, tsk. by the way you’re frowning, i don’t think you’re actually liking what you see, darling.” sheila scolded you as if you were a teenager. “tell me child, what made you so upset that even you can’t appreciate japans beauty?” she began to interrogate you with an intimidating tone. stuttering, you clasped your hands together and shrugged your shoulders almost forcefully.

“s'just feel pressured, i don’t wanna do things i don’t want to do but my management makes it really hard for me.” you answered, once again shrugging your shoulders.

“ahhh, the classic 'i’m too tired for this shit’ line, good one.” you didn’t know if she was joking or being serious so you decided to stay silent. “you know sweetie, at the end of the day, we’re all humans. so if you get sick of your life, then it’s totally normal.” she continued, “not everything is about money and fame, tell me y/n, when’s the last time you had a boyfriend?”

you opened your mouth to answer,

“one night stands are not included.” she quickly added,

your mouth automatically snapped shut.

“see what i’m talking about y/n?” you can practically feel her smugness rolling off as her point was proven right once again, “my advice to you is, maybe you should take a break from the limelight for awhile, go to a party and have a drink or two with your best friends…you know…what every other millennial does around this age.”

“but-”

“no buts girlie, you are to party tonight whether you like it or not.” she shushed you before you could even finish your words.

“i really wouldn’t be surprised if kiko had anything to do with this thinking of yours.” you commented with a roll of your eyes that had seemed to brighten thanks to sheila’s very much needed help.

“oh would you look at the time, i still have a back appointment for george, see you later y/n!” she didn’t allow you to speak as she was already out of the room before you even utter a syllable.

squinting your eyes together in confusion, you took a hold of your phone and proceeded to text kiko, asking about the bars whereabouts.

-

you were nervous as you carefully shimmied your slender body inside the expensive gucci dress. after asking kiko about the bars location in text form, she had automatically called you with an excited squeal and began with a 'omg! finally, bad ass y/n is back, i was starting to worry. just tell the taxi driver gold finger japan and you’ll be on your way in no time.’

and added a quick,

’make sure to dress crazy! lord knows it’ll be insane in there too.’

so here you are now 10 hours later, trying to carefully wrap yourself in gucci clothing. (surprise,surprise)

the outfit you had chosen was the craziest and most expensive thing you’ve brought with you, so if kiko didn’t consider this crazy, then you wouldn’t know what is.

looking at yourself in the gigantic mirror, you did a quick 360 degree turn and studied your reflection. and to be honest, you didn’t look bad on your opinion, in fact, you found yourself taking a selfie and posting it on instagram with the caption ’gucci should hire me’ making sure to tag the brand itself of course.

smiling to yourself, you checked your handbag once again, seeing if you had accidentally forgotten to bring your wallet, id, condo-card, or phone. breathing a silent sigh, you made your way outside.

-

you have arrived, and you weren’t the least bit surprised to see the bar packed up. thanking the taxi driver one last time, you walked up to the small looking building with a confident smile on your lips. you exchanged glances with a few of the people as you made your way to the karaoke section, considering that’s where kiko told you she was going to be.

though you wondered why she didn’t just choose to meet up with you near the bar all the way across the room.

smiling in content as you finally spotted kiko, you made your way to her without wasting another second, failing to notice that she wasn’t alone as she said she would be. as you started to near her, a frown visibly crawled its way onto your face, only now did you see that their were other people with her.

perhaps her friends, a thought echoed into your mind.

hesitantly, you lightly tapped your friends shoulder once you were near enough. the table she was sitting in was occupied by six people who on your opinion seemed to be enjoying their time a lot. kiko’s conversation with a girl sitting beside her was cut off as you stole her attention away.

“what the heck, kiko?” you hissed lowly at her, very much aware that the other five people she was with were now staring at you. caught like a deer by headlights, kiko’s eyes widened and she immediately stood up, quickly grasping for your clothed hand and forcing you to face the strangers you have yet to acknowledge.

“um guys, this is y/n, she’s the friend i was talking about earlier…” her introduction trailed off as she felt your heavy glare on the side of your face. guiltily, she flashed you a smile that quite literally said, 'i’m sorry, but at the same time, i’m not.’

“hey,” you mumbled, waving your free hand at them. choruses of 'nice to meet you’ greeted your eardrums as you took the last vacant seat right between kiko and a man whose name you’ve yet to find out.

“so y/n, this is lila.” kiko gestured to the girl she was talking with before you -now that you think about it- rudely interrupted. “that over there is chris,” blondie, “jeremy,” brunette, “mikee”, more brunette, “and sitting right next to you is harry.” she told you as soon as she managed to sit down on her chair.

you shook hands with each and every one of them, one particular man catching your eye before you turned your gaze away, seeing as you didn’t want to be one of those people who immediately get star struck at the sight of harry styles.

besides, you yourself didn’t like it when people thought of you indifferently at the mere mention of your reputation. treating him as if he was a king right now would be hypocritical of you.

though the questioning look you flashed kiko was failed to go unnoticed by the said woman.

“didn’t think their’d be this much people.” although six was hardly a lot, you were expecting only to be hanging out with just one person tonight.

“the more the merrier right?” jeremy inquired with a raised brow, you chuckled faintly at his words, exchanging a quick glance with kiko whose eyes said it all. shaking your head, you shrugged your shoulders and replied with a simple, “sure.”

-

a/n: harry

“i really wouldn’t be surprised if kiko had anything to do with this thinking of yours.” you commented with a roll of your eyes that had seemed to brighten thanks to sheila’s very much needed help.

“oh would you look at the time, i still have a back appointment for george, see you later y/n!” she didn’t allow you to speak as she was already out of the room before you even utter a syllable.

squinting your eyes together in confusion, you took a hold of your phone and proceeded to text kiko, asking about the bars whereabouts.

-

you were nervous as you carefully shimmied your slender body inside the expensive gucci dress. after asking kiko about the bars location in text form, she had automatically called you with an excited squeal and began with a 'omg! finally, bad ass y/n is back, i was starting to worry. just tell the taxi driver gold finger japan and you’ll be on your way in no time.’

and added a quick,

’make sure to dress crazy! lord knows it’ll be insane in there too.’

so here you are now 10 hours later, trying to carefully wrap yourself in gucci clothing. (surprise,surprise)

the outfit you had chosen was the craziest and most expensive thing you’ve brought with you, so if kiko didn’t consider this crazy, then you wouldn’t know what is.

looking at yourself in the gigantic mirror, you did a quick 360 degree turn and studied your reflection. and to be honest, you didn’t look bad on your opinion, in fact, you found yourself taking a selfie and posting it on instagram with the caption ’gucci should hire me’ making sure to tag the brand itself of course.

smiling to yourself, you checked your handbag once again, seeing if you had accidentally forgotten to bring your wallet, id, condo-card, or phone. breathing a silent sigh, you made your way outside.

-

you have arrived, and you weren’t the least bit surprised to see the bar packed up. thanking the taxi driver one last time, you walked up to the small looking building with a confident smile on your lips. you exchanged glances with a few of the people as you made your way to the karaoke section, considering that’s where kiko told you she was going to be.

though you wondered why she didn’t just choose to meet up with you near the bar all the way across the room.

smiling in content as you finally spotted kiko, you made your way to her without wasting another second, failing to notice that she wasn’t alone as she said she would be. as you started to near her, a frown visibly crawled its way onto your face, only now did you see that their were other people with her.

perhaps her friends, a thought echoed into your mind.

hesitantly, you lightly tapped your friends shoulder once you were near enough. the table she was sitting in was occupied by six people who on your opinion seemed to be enjoying their time a lot. kiko’s conversation with a girl sitting beside her was cut off as you stole her attention away.

“what the heck, kiko?” you hissed lowly at her, very much aware that the other five people she was with were now staring at you. caught like a deer by headlights, kiko’s eyes widened and she immediately stood up, quickly grasping for your clothed hand and forcing you to face the strangers you have yet to acknowledge.

“um guys, this is y/n, she’s the friend i was talking about earlier…” her introduction trailed off as she felt your heavy glare on the side of your face. guiltily, she flashed you a smile that quite literally said, 'i’m sorry, but at the same time, i’m not.’

“hey,” you mumbled, waving your free hand at them. choruses of 'nice to meet you’ greeted your eardrums as you took the last vacant seat right between kiko and a man whose name you’ve yet to find out.

“so y/n, this is lila.” kiko gestured to the girl she was talking with before you -now that you think about it- rudely interrupted. “that over there is chris,” blondie, “jeremy,” brunette, “mikee”, more brunette, “and sitting right next to you is harry.” she told you as soon as she managed to sit down on her chair.

you shook hands with each and every one of them, one particular man catching your eye before you turned your gaze away, seeing as you didn’t want to be one of those people who immediately get star struck at the sight of harry styles.

besides, you yourself didn’t like it when people thought of you indifferently at the mere mention of your reputation. treating him as if he was a king right now would be hypocritical of you.

though the questioning look you flashed kiko was failed to go unnoticed by the said woman.

“didn’t think their’d be this much people.” although six was hardly a lot, you were expecting only to be hanging out with just one person tonight.

“the more the merrier right?” jeremy inquired with a raised brow, you chuckled faintly at his words, exchanging a quick glance with kiko whose eyes said it all. shaking your head, you shrugged your shoulders and replied with a simple, “sure.”

-

“so have you changed your mind yet?” kiko, your friend, asked with a small grin plastered on her face. the two of you had met a few years ago on an award show and you two hit it off almost instantly. softly shrugging your shoulders, you rolled your eyes as you gazed down at the busy roads of japan.

“i don’t think i’m ready for such extreme actives.” you answered numbly, running a hand through your long gorgeous locks that many women seemed to envy, though you didn’t know why, you hair was as bad as t-series. (Subscribe to Pewdiepie) “besides, what the hell am i gonna do in a bar, let alone one for gays?” you rambled, “i mean there is a little bit of gay inside me, but that’s it.” your tone was finalized as you looked down at the beautiful asian woman sitting in front of you with a large pout on her face.

“we’ll do it for fun then!” she urged you as she locked her tiny hands around your endlessly long legs. frowning, you grumbled a curse under your breath and immediately stood up to make your way to the kitchen. you had been staying in an expensive modern condo in japan for more than 3 weeks despite kiko’s protests that you should stay in her home instead.

“no, kiko. but thanks for asking anyways.” you leaned your body down on the countertop as you spoke each word. practically writhing in disappointment, kiko flopped down on the humongous couch near the front door with a loud cry of mock frustration. biting down on your lip to stop yourself from laughing, you drank a large portion of your freshly made tea and decided to join the model.

“one of these days, y/n y/l/n. i might just kill myself because of you.” she stated in a deadpanned tone, and a string of colorful words soon followed. “we haven’t seen each other for 2 years!” she reminded you, “where’s the wild y/n i used to hang out with?” kiko narrowed her eyes at you.

smiling evilly, you flashed her a cheeky grin and said, “she died, along with the old taylor swift.” laughing mockingly as she groaned, you rolled over your belly and opened up social media.

“it’s not even funny!” she cried out, face palming dramatically just for good measure.

ignoring her, you continued to scroll down on your instagram feed and felt your eyes widen in surprise. “kiko mizuhara dating harry styles? what the hell, never heard of this one before.” the last part of your sentence was but a mumble. feeling kiko’s curious eyes at you, you turned to face her and lifted up your phone, “apparently you’re dating harry styles now, cool.” you snickered.

she sighed, a sigh that would usually mean exhaustion or annoyance. “i already tweeted about it a few weeks ago, but the rumors still haven’t died down. i haven’t even met the guy personally yet, and everybody’s making such a fuss about it.”

“interesting,” you commented, “says here you follow each other in ig?” you rose a brow at that.

“yeah, but that’s it!” she defended herself, arms crossing across her chest almost instantly. once she didn’t hear an immediate response from you, a loud scoff came out of her lips. “you seriously think that i would lie to you about my love life?”

“course,” you replied with no hesitation making kiko feel offended. “m'kidding of course, i know you’d never hide something like that.” you flashed her an eerie grin. as your thumb continued to scroll lower, a few comments caught your attention and you felt your insides start to burn in fury. “their hating on you? seriously? what the fuck is wrong with them?” you fumed.

“it’s fine y/n, really, it is. those words mean nothing to me because i know that they’re not real.” she gave you two thumbs ups, and a big smile, one that you didn’t think was genuine.

“who started this rumor anyways?” you leaned your head down on the comfy couch and lazily asked kiko. “some guy named dan, supposedly.” she replied, “or at least that’s what my manager told me.”

groaning, you stretched your limbs out and said “people nowadays are so fucked up…all for some easy money, christ.”

“that’s why i come to you for advice, we just really get each other.” she piped up, earning a small almost shy smile from you. “by the way, i heard that their’s going to be a new album soon-”

-

you were woken up by the sound of your alarm clock blasting at full volume, grumbling a quiet ‘fuck’ you stood up from the comfortable bed and made your way to the bathroom after grabbing your outfit of the day from your big suitcase. choosing to wear an simple, yet very expensive (I ain’t bluffing -author) iconic gucci shirt, you paired it with high waisted ripped jeans, and a new pair of nike shoes.

yesterday had been a blast for you. reuniting with one of your good friends felt great and it even inspired you to write a song about friendship. though you weren’t sure if it was going to be a part of the album.

reaching for the only pair of shades that you brought in japan, you scarfed down your carry on bag for a hat. grinning like a cheshire cat after managing to grasp one, you placed it on top of your hair that was yet to be done into a proper hairstyle, you quickly made your way to the buffet room, making sure to hide you face as to not disrupt your so far peaceful morning.

grabbing a plate, you made your way to the fruit section and placed a bunch of strawberries, mangoes, grapes on top of your plate along with a glass of milk. you walked to the furthest empty table in the room and was quick to take a bite out of the juicy fruits. but not before taking a picture of it and posting the said picture on instagram of course.

you decided to caption it with a short ’sweet like me’ phrase and left it at that. taking another juicy bite out of the strawberry, you leaned your back down on the chair and eyed the view in front of you. random people were passing by the five star hotel, not even bothering to give it a glance. though the foreigners were a bit different, their eyes held a different story from the locals who couldn’t care less about some extravagant hotel that they most likely see everyday.

sighing to yourself, you reached for the cup of warm milk and took a small sip before placing it carefully back on the fancy looking table. gazing down at the people who were walking freely outside, you felt a wafting burning sensation start to form in your chest. envy was what you felt as you stared at them. you envied them for their freedom, the power to walk around anywhere without being followed by paparazzi or diehard fans. (Not that you didn’t appreciate your fans because you totally do)

“such a lovely day, innit?” she commented, smiling lips covered with nude lipstick.

“couldn’t agree more,” you muttered softly.

“why so sad, dear.” her words were more of a statement than a question.  shaking your head, you gulped down what’s left with your glass of milk and said,

“nothing, just enjoying the view, is all.”

“s'just feel pressured, i don’t wanna do things i don’t want to do but my management makes it really hard for me.” you answered, once again shrugging your shoulders.

“ahhh, the classic 'i’m too tired for this shit’ line, good one.” you didn’t know if she was joking or being serious so you decided to stay silent. “you know sweetie, at the end of the day, we’re all humans. so if you get sick of your life, then it’s totally normal.” she continued, “not everything is about money and fame, tell me y/n, when’s the last time you had a boyfriend?”

you opened your mouth to answer,

“one night stands are not included.” she quickly added,

your mouth automatically snapped shut.

“see what i’m talking about y/n?” you can practically feel her smugness rolling off as her point was proven right once again, “my advice to you is, maybe you should take a break from the limelight for awhile, go to a party and have a drink or two with your best friends…you know…what every other millennial does around this age.”

you shook hands with each and every one of them, one particular man catching your eye before you turned your gaze away, seeing as you didn’t want to be one of those people who immediately get star struck at the sight of harry styles.

besides, you yourself didn’t like it when people thought of you indifferently at the mere mention of your reputation. treating him as if he was a king right now would be hypocritical of you.

though the questioning look you flashed kiko was failed to go unnoticed by the said woman.

“didn’t think their’d be this much people.” although six was hardly a lot, you were expecting only to be hanging out with just one person tonight.

“the more the merrier right?” jeremy inquired with a raised brow, you chuckled faintly at his words, exchanging a quick glance with kiko whose eyes said it all. shaking your head, you shrugged your shoulders and replied with a simple, “sure.”

-

body:
A Cheat IV (alt ending)

An alternate ending to A Cheat series where they end up together.

Summary: Harry regrets his actions and Y/N forgives

Warnings: slight angst, fluff

Word count: 1.5k

Based on: a happy ending for Harry and y/n!!

@ynm1505 @imamahems4life

After a few months of separation from the one and only Harry Styles, did Y/N ever move on from him? Yes and no. She was slowly coming out of the shell that Harry catapulted her into because of his self-destructing actions but was also more cautious of anything and everything. Each person she meets had to pass her hierarchal exam where she observed if that person was worth Y/N sharing her past with. Having a relationship with a pop star certainly abided more people her way, most of them being fake and only mean to use her to get closer to Harry. Even when he wasn’t around anymore, he was still influencing her to act on things with him in mind.

And no, she wasn’t getting over him because it was more of like a seesaw progress, she kept going back and forth between being over him and missing him too much that she really doesn’t consider herself to be over over, you know? She has gone on dates after him, there were some really great guys out there and she felt a connection between maybe two guys, but there wasn’t any sparkle—at least not the one she and Harry had. Although she felt excited going on a date with Alan from time to time, she didn’t exactly feel as thrilled as she was with Harry. She didn’t feel exhilarated with anybody else (thus far) and she was agitated at herself. No matter how much she tried, she couldn’t seem to get him out of her thoughts. Just seeing an apron reminded her of him and how he ‘used to be a baker’. Y/N was annoyed.

Speaking of Alan, he had admitted his feelings for Y/N a while back adding on that it was okay if she didn’t feel the same. After all, it was worth a shot. And trust her, she strained her beliefs to tell herself that maybe she could like Alan, see him in a different way other than a best friend type of thing. She’s still trying her absolute hardest and Alan understood that. Feelings don’t just change in an instant –even though it was more than six months since that happened. She scolds herself sometimes when she’s alone because Alan is such a good guy and he’s perfect for her, but she can’t seem to give her heart away—because Harry still has it.

So they’ve been exclusive for a few weeks, Y/N was testing the waters, going deeper and deeper to see how far she can go before she cowers back in complete abandonment of a new relationship. Her heart was light, she had forgiven Harry for cheating on her. She was personally really really happy and maybe it’s got to do with the fact that she hasn’t seen him face-to-face ever since, but it’s almost as if she has put it behind her. Y/N was rejuvenating herself, as silly as it sounds, in the best way she knew how. That was by throwing away all the negativity and only focusing on the positive. Y/N didn’t like cheaters but she also wasn’t very fond of holding grudges. She believes that people could change with time and six months is a long time for Harry to reflect on his past.

—–

Alan and Y/N decided to go grocery shopping to bake some cupcakes. At times, there were some paparazzi who still deem her important that they felt the need to photograph her whereabouts, even though she’ll probably end up on a postage-sized column on the paper. Not to put herself down, but she was an ordinary girl and she wasn’t dating Harry anymore so she didn’t understand why they still correlated her to him.

“Okay so I just ran out of flour so I’m gonna get that,” Y/N hums as she directs Alan what to get. “I’ll get the dry ingredients and you can get the icing, eggs, vanilla, all the sweet stuff, yeah?”

“Yup! I got it, holler at me if you need me to reach something from the top shelf,” He winks at Y/N knowing that standing on her tippy toes wasn’t enough to grab the bag of powder.

She slaps his arm slightly, amused at his joke and playing offended because of his height shaming.

“Pffft, watch me do this on my own,”

He rolls his eyes before walking away, clutching his stomach from laughing too much.

——

“Baking powder, check. Baking soda, check. Icing sugar, check. Ooh, flour!” She gasps, halting. She can’t believe that she almost forgot the flour.

There was only one thing that stood between her and delicious cupcake making and that was the shelf. She could see the yellow bag towering over her, tilting a bit as if to tease her for not having enough height to reach it. She huffs, going on her tiptoes even though she knows she won’t even come close.

Y/N stresses to put her hands on her hips, mouth opening to do a small whisper-shout for Alan but before she could, a gruff voice comes to her aid.

“Need help?”

She turns around, mouth dropping open in surprise. She had to grasp the shopping cart handles to steady herself from a heart attack she felt upon seeing her ex-boyfriend, Harry.

“Oh, hi! Yes, please,” she feels herself do an awkward wave, giggling uncomfortably.

He slowly walks over to where she was reaching for the flour. His large hand easily grabs hold of the item, handing it to her.

“Here ya’ go,” Harry delivers her a charming smile and she swore her heart just melted.

Funnily enough, this wasn’t how she pictured seeing Harry again. And this wasn’t how she imagined feeling. It was like seeing an old friend after a long time; relived and joyful to see them glowing. She tucks a strand of hair behind her ears, looking down at the tips of her shoes, unsure of what to say to him.

“I’ve missed you. Can we tal–,” Harry begins.

“I didn’t hear any hollering so I’m guessing you got it all by yourself, little Y/N,” Alan strolls over to her isle, not noticing Harry’s figure and gives a light rub on her head messing up her hair. She pouts at him, mentally counting the items in his arms to see if he got everything.

“No, no–uh, Harry helped me,” She gestures towards Harry, fingers attaching themselves to the back of her neck.

Harry gives a polite wave and a nod, Alan shifts his glance towards him lips set firmly in a thin line.

“Ahh, Styles what are you doing here?”

Harry lifts his cart; “I’m shopping,”

There was a silence between the three, Y/N not knowing what to say.

“Actually, Y/N can I talk to you?” Harry questions her, hoping that she’d let him. Y/N nods, but Alan stays planted on the spot beside her. “Alone?”

She turns to Alan whispering something in his ear and he couldn’t help but feel a little jealous.

“You sure?” Alan looks deeply into her eyes, searching for any sign of discomfort. She nods again.

Harry raises his brow and Y/N nods to signal that she was ready when he was. He starts walking towards a different aisle, expecting Y/N to follow him. Just before she could take a step, Alan calls her name softly, vulnerable.

“You still love him don’t you?”

Y/N tries to stall her answer but inevitably nods. He deserves to know the truth, even when it hurts. Alan sighs.

“Yes, I do. I’m sorry, Al”

“It’s okay, Y/N. You can’t control your feelings,” He pats her shoulder, seeing Harry stop and turn around when he realized that Y/N wasn’t following him from his peripherals. “Besides, I met a girl,”

Y/N gasps, pushing his chest lightly. “What! Why didn’t you tell me you goof,”

Alan laughs at her excitement, nudging her hip with his. “I’ll tell you all about her later. But for now, Prince Charming looks pissed at me for keeping you,” He winks at Y/N.

“Thank you, Alan” She gets engulfed by his long arms, feeling murmur something in her hair.

“Go tell him you love him,”

Y/N jogs over to Harry with a smile but he doesn’t look too happy. He pays for his four items quickly before walking over to the parking lot area near his car.

“How long have you guys been dating?”

“Wha-? Alan and I are not together,” Harry’s eyes widen at the misconception he’d conjured up.

“Oh…”

There was a pregnant pause before Y/N decided to shoot her shot. She takes a deep breath, telling herself that it’s okay if he didn’t feel the same.

“I still love you, Harry.” She bites her lip, looking nervous into his green eyes while his only stared back at her without saying anything.

“Wait I shouldn’t have said anything. It’s fine you kno–-hmph”

Her lips were clamped shut with Harry’s plump ones. Hands finding her waist and pulling her body impossibly closer to his. It was a short kiss but enough to show each other how they felt.

“I love you too, Y/N.”

@ynm1505 @imamahems4life

After a few months of separation from the one and only Harry Styles, did Y/N ever move on from him? Yes and no. She was slowly coming out of the shell that Harry catapulted her into because of his self-destructing actions but was also more cautious of anything and everything. Each person she meets had to pass her hierarchal exam where she observed if that person was worth Y/N sharing her past with. Having a relationship with a pop star certainly abided more people her way, most of them being fake and only mean to use her to get closer to Harry. Even when he wasn’t around anymore, he was still influencing her to act on things with him in mind.

And no, she wasn’t getting over him because it was more of like a seesaw progress, she kept going back and forth between being over him and missing him too much that she really doesn’t consider herself to be over over, you know? She has gone on dates after him, there were some really great guys out there and she felt a connection between maybe two guys, but there wasn’t any sparkle—at least not the one she and Harry had. Although she felt excited going on a date with Alan from time to time, she didn’t exactly feel as thrilled as she was with Harry. She didn’t feel exhilarated with anybody else (thus far) and she was agitated at herself. No matter how much she tried, she couldn’t seem to get him out of her thoughts. Just seeing an apron reminded her of him and how he ‘used to be a baker’. Y/N was annoyed.

Speaking of Alan, he had admitted his feelings for Y/N a while back adding on that it was okay if she didn’t feel the same. After all, it was worth a shot. And trust her, she strained her beliefs to tell herself that maybe she could like Alan, see him in a different way other than a best friend type of thing. She’s still trying her absolute hardest and Alan understood that. Feelings don’t just change in an instant –even though it was more than six months since that happened. She scolds herself sometimes when she’s alone because Alan is such a good guy and he’s perfect for her, but she can’t seem to give her heart away—because Harry still has it.

So they’ve been exclusive for a few weeks, Y/N was testing the waters, going deeper and deeper to see how far she can go before she cowers back in complete abandonment of a new relationship. Her heart was light, she had forgiven Harry for cheating on her. She was personally really really happy and maybe it’s got to do with the fact that she hasn’t seen him face-to-face ever since, but it’s almost as if she has put it behind her. Y/N was rejuvenating herself, as silly as it sounds, in the best way she knew how. That was by throwing away all the negativity and only focusing on the positive. Y/N didn’t like cheaters but she also wasn’t very fond of holding grudges. She believes that people could change with time and six months is a long time for Harry to reflect on his past.

—–

Alan and Y/N decided to go grocery shopping to bake some cupcakes. At times, there were some paparazzi who still deem her important that they felt the need to photograph her whereabouts, even though she’ll probably end up on a postage-sized column on the paper. Not to put herself down, but she was an ordinary girl and she wasn’t dating Harry anymore so she didn’t understand why they still correlated her to him.

“Okay so I just ran out of flour so I’m gonna get that,” Y/N hums as she directs Alan what to get. “I’ll get the dry ingredients and you can get the icing, eggs, vanilla, all the sweet stuff, yeah?”

“Yup! I got it, holler at me if you need me to reach something from the top shelf,” He winks at Y/N knowing that standing on her tippy toes wasn’t enough to grab the bag of powder.

She slaps his arm slightly, amused at his joke and playing offended because of his height shaming.

“Pffft, watch me do this on my own,”

He rolls his eyes before walking away, clutching his stomach from laughing too much.

——

“Baking powder, check. Baking soda, check. Icing sugar, check. Ooh, flour!” She gasps, halting. She can’t believe that she almost forgot the flour.

There was only one thing that stood between her and delicious cupcake making and that was the shelf. She could see the yellow bag towering over her, tilting a bit as if to tease her for not having enough height to reach it. She huffs, going on her tiptoes even though she knows she won’t even come close.

Y/N stresses to put her hands on her hips, mouth opening to do a small whisper-shout for Alan but before she could, a gruff voice comes to her aid.

“Need help?”

She turns around, mouth dropping open in surprise. She had to grasp the shopping cart handles to steady herself from a heart attack she felt upon seeing her ex-boyfriend, Harry.

“Oh, hi! Yes, please,” she feels herself do an awkward wave, giggling uncomfortably.

He slowly walks over to where she was reaching for the flour. His large hand easily grabs hold of the item, handing it to her.

“Here ya’ go,” Harry delivers her a charming smile and she swore her heart just melted.

Funnily enough, this wasn’t how she pictured seeing Harry again. And this wasn’t how she imagined feeling. It was like seeing an old friend after a long time; relived and joyful to see them glowing. She tucks a strand of hair behind her ears, looking down at the tips of her shoes, unsure of what to say to him.

“I’ve missed you. Can we tal–,” Harry begins.

“I didn’t hear any hollering so I’m guessing you got it all by yourself, little Y/N,” Alan strolls over to her isle, not noticing Harry’s figure and gives a light rub on her head messing up her hair. She pouts at him, mentally counting the items in his arms to see if he got everything.

“No, no–uh, Harry helped me,” She gestures towards Harry, fingers attaching themselves to the back of her neck.

Harry gives a polite wave and a nod, Alan shifts his glance towards him lips set firmly in a thin line.

“Ahh, Styles what are you doing here?”

Harry lifts his cart; “I’m shopping,”

There was a silence between the three, Y/N not knowing what to say.

“Actually, Y/N can I talk to you?” Harry questions her, hoping that she’d let him. Y/N nods, but Alan stays planted on the spot beside her. “Alone?”

She turns to Alan whispering something in his ear and he couldn’t help but feel a little jealous.

“You sure?” Alan looks deeply into her eyes, searching for any sign of discomfort. She nods again.

Harry raises his brow and Y/N nods to signal that she was ready when he was. He starts walking towards a different aisle, expecting Y/N to follow him. Just before she could take a step, Alan calls her name softly, vulnerable.

“You still love him don’t you?”

Y/N tries to stall her answer but inevitably nods. He deserves to know the truth, even when it hurts. Alan sighs.

“Yes, I do. I’m sorry, Al”

“It’s okay, Y/N. You can’t control your feelings,” He pats her shoulder, seeing Harry stop and turn around when he realized that Y/N wasn’t following him from his peripherals. “Besides, I met a girl,”

Y/N gasps, pushing his chest lightly. “What! Why didn’t you tell me you goof,”

Alan laughs at her excitement, nudging her hip with his. “I’ll tell you all about her later. But for now, Prince Charming looks pissed at me for keeping you,” He winks at Y/N.

“Thank you, Alan” She gets engulfed by his long arms, feeling murmur something in her hair.

“Go tell him you love him,”

Y/N jogs over to Harry with a smile but he doesn’t look too happy. He pays for his four items quickly before walking over to the parking lot area near his car.

“How long have you guys been dating?”

“Wha-? Alan and I are not together,” Harry’s eyes widen at the misconception he’d conjured up.

“Oh…”

There was a pregnant pause before Y/N decided to shoot her shot. She takes a deep breath, telling herself that it’s okay if he didn’t feel the same.

“I still love you, Harry.” She bites her lip, looking nervous into his green eyes while his only stared back at her without saying anything.

“Wait I shouldn’t have said anything. It’s fine you kno–-hmph”

Her lips were clamped shut with Harry’s plump ones. Hands finding her waist and pulling her body impossibly closer to his. It was a short kiss but enough to show each other how they felt.

“I love you too, Y/N.”

body:
We’ve passed 3:00 AM here in Iowa and here I am….still awake watching Madam Secretary.

I need my medication to kick in so I can sleep but it, of course, hasn’t and won’t likely for a little while longer.

So I’m writing. 

Yes, you read that correctly.

I. AM. WRITING.

The next chapter has passed 7,200 words and is getting much closer to where I want to end it.

Woo!!!!
